title: Retail inflation rises to eight-year high of 7.79% in April
content:
Indiaâ€™s retail inflation rose to 7.79% in the month of April, driven by high prices of food and fuel, government data showed on Thursday. The price rise indicator is at its highest level in eight years, The Hindu reported. In March, retail inflation was at a 17-month high of 6.95%.Retail inflation has now remained above the limit prescribed by the Reserve Bank of India for four straight months. Among food items, the highest level of inflation was registered in oils and fats (17.28%), followed by vegetables (15.41%).
